content.description: Climb a zigzagging, OW splitter to a small, left-facing, hands corner.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: Climb bulging off-fingers to a small roof.  Pass the roof on great finger locks and continue up easier terrain to the chains.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: Climb a flared slot with thin hands in the back for about 10 feet, and traverse left ~3 feet to an obvious, horizontal slot that takes 1.5" gear.  Continue up easy runout face to a thin crack in a featured corner.  Climb crack and face to the chains.
content.location:
Use the same start as

Sign of Abundance

, see the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: Climb the 1st 10 feet of Tracks, and continue up and right around a large chockstone on an easy face.  Continue up via mostly hands and face to the chains.
content.location:
This shares a start with

Tracks

, see the photo on the main page.

content.description: Climb into a flared slot to gain a good hand crack.  Climb mostly hands with lots of good face holds to the chains.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: This is one of the best routes on the wall.  Start up a slab to an undercut and 1st bolt.  Make a really long reach or deadpoint to pass the bolt (1st crux) and clip the 2nd bolt. Move up the arete and then out right to clip the 3rd bolt.  Make a bouldery move up and left to good holds (2nd crux) and continue up the arete past 1 more bolt.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: Climb over some blocks to gain a right-facing corner that takes 1.5-2.0" gear.  Climb the corner and mantle onto a ledge below a steep face with a black water streak.  Climb sequential face (crux) past 2 bolts to a rest below thin cracks.  Climb crack and face to the chains.
content.protection: Small wires to thin hands, 2 bolts.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the wall.  See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description:
This route tackles a low bulge to some delicate moves ending with a jug and passing a roof to a pocketed headwall.  It has great movement on good rock.  There is a hollow sounding block in the roof that is solid for now.

A shoulder length sling recommended for 1st bolt.  If you blow the crux moves between the 1st and 2nd bolts, you will hit the ground.
content.protection: 3 bolts and gear.  A horizontal crack above the 3rd bolt will take 1.0" or 2.0-2.5" cams.
content.location:
To access the chains to this route, rap down

3rd Dimension

and swing over ~5 feet.

content.description: Climb over some hollow but solid blocks to gain a flaring, left-facing corner.  Chimney, stem, and jam the featured corner to the chains.
content.protection: Fingers through hands, 1 5" piece for the bottom.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.
